snippet: As commercial mortgage loans issued during the boom years come due, the insanity of that market may be exemplified by what happened at the Pinnacle Group.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column observes the first of the commercial mortgages issued in 2007 have started to come due, and it is becoming clear just how bad many of the loans were; notes delinquency rates on mortgage-backed securities have risen to the highest level ever; describes an egregious example of the craziness of the market at the time, the loan on Manhattan apartment buildings held by Pinnacle Group.
lead_paragraph: As commercial mortgage loans issued during the boom years come due, the insanity of that market may be exemplified by what happened at the Pinnacle Group.

headline.print_headline: Commercial Mortgages Show How Bad It Got
headline.seo: Bad Mortgage Loans Burn Investors and Tenants - High and Low Finance
headline.main: Commercial Mortgages Show How Bad It Got
